content.question:
The following table shows statistics on the ages, in years, of the people who attended a lecture last week. The data are summarized in the boxplot shown.

<math alttext="number of people" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Mean
 <math alttext="Standard Deviation" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>StDev</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Minimum
 <math alttext="first quartile " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Median
 <math alttext="third quartile" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Maximum

45
 43
 12
 20
 33
 44
 53
 65

Which of the following statements is supported by the table and boxplot?

choices.label: The range of the distribution is 20 years.
There were 43 people who attended the lecture.
At least 50% of the people who attended the lecture were 43 years or younger.
At least 75% of the people who attended the lecture were age 53 years or younger.
At least 25% of the people who attended the lecture were 33 years old.

content.answer: At least 75% of the people who attended the lecture were age 53 years or younger.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
